question.title: Why am I able to run a Java file using the "java" program without first compiling using "javac"?
question.body:
I have just started to learn JAVA, I am not from CS background. So far I have understood Java scripts needs two step compilation (compile time and Run time). (javac File_name.java). This will create a .class file which is platform independent bytecode. Further if i Use (java File_name), it will execute the program. Recently I have notice if I simply use (java File_name.java), I am getting the output. Even I have checked my directory there is no .class file generated. Can anyone please explain why this is happening. If a bytecode is getting generated, then where can i find it? Note: I have used the path for java.exe

I tried ,<directory of source code> java File_name.java

I expected some errors

i got the output
